info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 11 at 9:29PM EDT until September 11 at 11:30PM EDT by NWS Key West FL
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...Upper Keys of Monroe County between Islamorada and Craig Key.
* WHEN...Until 1130 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 928 PM EDT, National Weather Service Meteorologist detected heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Teatable Key, Lower Matecumbe Key, Upper Matecumbe Key and Islamorada. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Do not drive your vehicle into areas where the water covers the roadway. The water depth may be too great to allow your car to cross safely.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 PM EDT THIS EVENING
